meanings.definition: A person acknowledged as holy or virtuous and typically regarded as being in heaven after death.
meanings.sent1: The village celebrated the local saint for his kindness.
meanings.sent2: The community admired Mother Teresa as a true saint.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous child jokingly called his teacher a saint for giving less homework.
meanings.sent4: Her patience in the face of adversity made her a saint in the eyes of her friends.
meanings.sent5: The old man's wisdom and compassion painted him as a saint among his peers.

meanings.definition: A person of great holiness, virtue, or benevolence.
meanings.sent1: The saint's selfless acts inspired others to be kind.
meanings.sent2: Many consider Gandhi to be a saint for his peaceful resistance.
meanings.sent3: The saintly baker always gave extra cookies to the children.
meanings.sent4: Her generosity knew no bounds, making her a saint in the eyes of the needy.
meanings.sent5: His saintly deeds shone brightly in the dark world of greed and selfishness.

meanings.definition: A member of the Christian Church declared to be a saint.
meanings.sent1: The church honored the saint with a special feast day.
meanings.sent2: Saint Peter is one of the most well-known saints in Christianity.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous child jokingly claimed to be a saint after helping an elderly lady.
meanings.sent4: Her dedication to her faith made her a saint in the eyes of the congregation.
meanings.sent5: The saint's prayers were said to have miraculous powers among the believers.
